But even if I had all of those things I would still BE DISABLED because I wouldn't be able to get out of bed and care for myself, work or socialise effectively on flare days, and so: lack of nuance. The theory is too rigid.

For eg, for the social model re my Chronic Migraine I am disabled by cultural attitudes and misconceptions of my disability; by employers refusal to accommodate and view of me as 'imconvenient', peoples assuming I am 'faking it', the lack of flexible working opps and effective financial support.

The social model of disability holds that people are disabled by barriers in society (lack of infrastructure, cultural attitudes etc) rather than their difference. This is sort of right but lacks nuance in that disabilities can of course be physically/mentally limiting regardless of infrastructure.

In terms of what to bring, generally consensus seems to be 2-10 of items depending on what's most popular but that's hard to judge for your first event.

For markets I usually take 3-5  of each pin, same of prints, and all my stickers because they're not super heavy.

For display height variance really helps catch the eye and make things easy to browse. You don't need fancy display stuff right out of the gate if you have some boxes laying around?

Don't forget: price labels, paper bags, business cards or QR display with link, cash float; £10-20 should be fine.

Friends! Here's how to remove ai from your google searches using the example; fantasy horse 

Fantasy horse, before:2023 
Brings up everything posted ONLY before the year 2023 

Fantasy horse, -ai -prompt -stock -openai 
Gets rid of MOST generative images and includes current/recent images

With the holiday season right around the corner, I want to just put this out there.
Every purchase from an indie crafter is an investment in their dream instead of a millionaire/billionaire getting a luxury boat or second home.

It's food in the bellies of working class people.
It is daunting at first for sure. There's not really a single standard, which doesn't help. But I'm constantly being recommended this handbook for pricing advice: www.amazon.co.uk/dp/026254239...

The one that jumped into my head is Dexter, not because it's a banger of a song or anything but because it matched the show and the intro video so perfectly that it gets stuck in my head anytime I happen to remember the show.

So weird how as soon as the pandemic started it became very immediately clear that things like socialized medicine and giving people money so children don’t starve actually work really well but now that it’s been a couple years we have to all pretend we didn’t notice that

Hospital escape hard mode:
- It's night
- half the lights are off
- There are no staff in sight! 

Did I get out or was I devoured by The Spiral!?
